replies.body:
@FrankenRavi, Did you not read the post? really.. this is my friends computer! And i want my own instead of constantly having to ask him for it!, Learn to read m8! (No offence) xD..

And
@fishisea, Titan black is a really good PC (Google it) At most around 25k$USD, and it has a WAY better graphics card than a GTX 780 SLI, 32 gigs of ram and 4 TB's of HDD space... In most cases runs minecraft at an Amazing 1500 Fps if using shaders, recording and max settings - Lowest settings, without shaders-And recording it does about 2000-2500 fps, At a budget at 5k You can get on for 10k Which i actually have spare (Im not rich, this is hard earned money). So yea... I will be replying tomorrow again at 10AM Central time :) Hope to see you there! :)

replies.body:
Thou shall not need an HDD with 4GB of space, (unless you do a ton of recording and editing and need *that* much space)... Depends really on your needs.

Boot and run the OS from the SSD, and just store whatever you need to store on your HDD.
replies.body_tagged:
Thou shall not need an HDD with 4GB of space, (unless you do a ton of recording and editing and need *that* much space)... Depends really on your needs.

Boot and run the OS from the SSD, and just store whatever you need to store on your HDD.

replies.body:
A single 780ti beats a titan black for half the price..
And a titan black is a graphics card? not a pc
And you said your friend had that alienware pc for over 3 years,
the titan z only recently got released.
And I'm sure you'll only reach 3k fps+ With either an overclocked i7, or an overclocked i7 extreme series cpu.

And tell me, which gpu can beat a 780ti in SLI?

And how is it possible that with an i7 4960x, 32gb of ram (assuming some is allocated to mc) and a titan z, you got 400-800 fps?

I get 300-650 with an i7 3770, 8gb of ram and a gtx 660?

And if this "titan black" you speak of actually is a pc, why are you getting it if its 25k and your max budget is 5k?
And I understood you had 10k spare, 5k + 10k = 15k.
Tbh, I think you're a bit lost.
replies.body_tagged:
A single 780ti beats a titan black for half the price..
And a titan black is a graphics card? not a pc
And you said your friend had that alienware pc for over 3 years,
the titan z only recently got released.
And I'm sure you'll only reach 3k fps+ With either an overclocked i7, or an overclocked i7 extreme series cpu.

And tell me, which gpu can beat a 780ti in SLI?

And how is it possible that with an i7 4960x, 32gb of ram (assuming some is allocated to mc) and a titan z, you got 400-800 fps?

I get 300-650 with an i7 3770, 8gb of ram and a gtx 660?

And if this "titan black" you speak of actually is a pc, why are you getting it if its 25k and your max budget is 5k?
And I understood you had 10k spare, 5k + 10k = 15k.
Tbh, I think you're a bit lost.

replies.body:
Did you get the Intel Core i7-4820K, 4930K or the 4960X? 

IMO the 4960X is just overkill and mainly intended for bragging rights. Only difference is the 12MB and 15MB of cache, other than that the 4930K performs almost exactly like the 4960X.

And the Titan Z... Just... *sigh* You're better off with a Nvidia GTX 780Ti.
replies.body_tagged:

IMO the 4960X is just overkill and mainly intended for bragging rights. Only difference is the 12MB and 15MB of cache, other than that the 4930K performs almost exactly like the 4960X.

And the Titan Z... Just... *sigh* You're better off with a Nvidia GTX 780Ti.
